definition: variant pronunciation (when the same character has more than one reading)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: The command of the accurate pronunciation of polyphonic characters is the key to the standardization of Chinese character pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 準確掌握多音異讀字是人們規範認讀漢字的關鍵。

sentences.english: Chapter II briefly describes analysis of Quanzhou County, Caiwan dialect's Wen and Bai reading.
sentences.chinese: 第二章簡要描寫分析了全州縣才灣話的文白異讀。

sentences.english: Chapter Three Literal and Colloquial Pronunciations and Phonetic Layers in Yanchuan Dialect.
sentences.chinese: 第三章“延川方言的文白異讀與語音層次”。

sentences.english: In those passages where there is a variant reading, no doctrine of Scripture is affected.
sentences.chinese: 這些有着‘異讀’的段落並不影響聖經的教義。

sentences.english: Different reading is an important voice phenomenon of ancient Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 異讀是古漢語的一個重要語音現象。

sentences.english: There are some passages in the New Testament in which we have 'variant readings.
sentences.chinese: 我們對於一些新約的聖經段落有着‘異讀’。
